content:
It's always a good idea to prepare your own warm-up routine before attending a dance workshop, especially if you're new to hip-hop. Here's why:

1. **Injury prevention**: A proper warm-up can help prevent injuries by increasing blood flow, reducing muscle tension, and preparing your joints for movement.
2. **Improved flexibility**: A warm-up can help increase your flexibility and range of motion, making it easier to execute movements during the workshop.
3. **Mental preparation**: A warm-up can help you get focused, centered, and ready to learn.

That being said, the workshop instructor might provide a warm-up routine as part of the class. However, it's always better to be prepared and have your own routine in case they don't provide one or if you need extra time to get ready.

Here's a simple warm-up routine you can follow:

1. **Light cardio**: 5-10 minutes of light cardio such as jogging in place, jumping jacks, or cycling to get your heart rate up and warm your muscles.
2. **Dynamic stretching**: 5-10 minutes of dynamic stretching such as leg swings, arm circles, hip circles, and torso twists to loosen up your muscles and increase flexibility.
3. **Mobility exercises**: 5-10 minutes of mobility exercises such as leg raises, ankle rotations, and hip openers to prepare your joints and muscles for movement.
4. **Muscle activations**: 5-10 minutes of muscle activations such as glute bridges, planks, or wall sits to engage your core and prepare your muscles for movement.

Remember to keep your warm-up routine gentle and gradual, especially if you're new to hip-hop. You can always adjust the intensity and duration based on your individual needs and fitness level.

It's also a good idea to arrive at the workshop early to allow time for your warm-up routine. You can do your warm-up in the studio or outside before the workshop starts.

Have fun at the workshop, and don't hesitate to ask the instructor if you have any questions or concerns!
